edu.rit.image

Class GrayArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.image.GrayArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable

    public class GrayArray
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class GrayArray provides an array of gray shades.

    Note: An instance of class GrayArray uses less storage than an array of instances of class Gray.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GrayArray()
      Construct a new zero-length gray array.
      GrayArray(GrayArray array)
      Construct a new gray array that is a copy of the given gray array.
      GrayArray(int len)
      Construct a new gray array of the given length.

      Set the given element of this gray array to the given gray shade.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GrayArray

        public GrayArray()
        Construct a new zero-length gray array.

      • GrayArray

        public GrayArray(int len)
        Construct a new gray array of the given length. Each element is a gray shade of black.
        Parameters:
        len - Array length.

      • GrayArray

        public GrayArray(GrayArray array)
        Construct a new gray array that is a copy of the given gray array.
        Parameters:
        array - Gray array to copy.

    • Method Detail

      • length

        public int length()
        Get this gray array's length.
        Returns:
        Array length.

      • gray

        public int gray(int i)
        Get the gray shade of the given element of this gray array. The gray shade is an integer in the range 0 (black) through 255 (white).
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        Returns:
        Gray shade.

      • gray

        public GrayArray gray(int i,
             int shade)
        Set the given element of this gray array to the given gray shade. The gray shade is an integer in the range 0 (black) through 255 (white). Only bits 7-0 are used.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        shade - Gray shade.
        Returns:
        This gray array.

      • gray

        public GrayArray gray(int i,
             int shade,
             boolean zeroIsBlack)
        Set the given element of this gray array to the given gray shade. The gray shade is an integer in the range 0 through 255. Only bits 7-0 are used. If zeroIsBlack is true, then 0 = black and 255 = white. If zeroIsBlack is false, then 0 = white and 255 = black.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        shade - Gray shade.
        zeroIsBlack - True if 0 = black, false if 0 = white.
        Returns:
        This gray array.

      • gray

        public GrayArray gray(int i,
             float shade)
        Set the given element of this gray array to the given gray shade. The gray shade is a floating point number in the range 0.0f (black) through 1.0f (white). Values outside that range are pinned to that range.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        shade - Gray shade.
        Returns:
        This gray array.

      • gray

        public GrayArray gray(int i,
             float shade,
             boolean zeroIsBlack)
        Set the given element of this gray array to the given gray shade. The gray shade is a floating point number in the range 0.0f through 1.0f. Values outside that range are pinned to that range. If zeroIsBlack is true, then 0.0f = black and 1.0f = white. If zeroIsBlack is false, then 0.0f = white and 1.0f = black.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        shade - Gray shade.
        zeroIsBlack - True if 0.0f = black, false if 0.0f = white.
        Returns:
        This gray array.

      • copy

        public void copy(GrayArray src,
        int srcoff,
        int dstoff,
        int len)
        Copy a portion of the given gray array into this gray array.
        Parameters:
        src - Source gray array.
        srcoff - First index to read in source gray array.
        dstoff - First index to write in this gray array.
        len - Number of elements to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a nonexistent index in the source gray array would be read or a nonexistent index in this gray array would be written.
